text: Bulgar (also known as Bulghar, Bolgar, or Bolghar) is an extinct Oghur Turkic language spoken by the Bulgars. The name came from the Bulgars, a tribe that established the Bulgar state known as Old Great Bulgaria in the mid-7th century, which became the Danubian Bulgaria by the 680s.Encyclop√¶dia Britannica Online - Bolgar Turkic Campbell, George L. Compendium of the World's Languages. Routledge, 2000. page 274 == References == Category:Languages of Europe Category:Turkic languages Category:Extinct languages
title: Bulgar language
